findScopeForNegDependency

protected static void findScopeForNegDependency(gate.Annotation govenorToken,
                                                gate.AnnotationSet triggerWordsAnnotationSet,
                                                gate.AnnotationSet tokenAnnotationSetOfSentence,
                                                String outputAnnotationType,
                                                gate.AnnotationSet syntaxTreeNodeAnnotationSet,
                                                HashMap<Integer,ArrayList<Integer>> tokenPathsOfDoc,
                                                ArrayList<gate.Annotation> notAnnotationsAlreadyAnnotated,
                                                Integer depID,
                                                gate.AnnotationSet outputScopeAnnotations,
                                                gate.AnnotationSet depRelationsSetOfSentence)
method name:findScopeForNegDependency() this method is called from the switch case in the execute() method from the ExtractNegatorScope class. function: this method takes care of the neg dependency case. Specifically, it will subdivide the more general cases into more constrained cases within (new conditions).Depending on the new constraints, this method will then call the relevent method to annotate the scope.

markNeither

protected static void markNeither(gate.AnnotationSet tokenAnnotationSetOfSentence,
                                  gate.AnnotationSet triggerWordsAnnotationSet,
                                  gate.AnnotationSet outputScopeAnnotations,
                                  gate.AnnotationSet syntaxTreeNodeAnnotationSet,
                                  ArrayList<gate.Annotation> notAnnotationsAlreadyAnnotated,
                                  String outputAnnotationType,
                                  gate.AnnotationSet depRelationsSetOfSentence,
                                  gate.Annotation govenorToken,
                                  Integer depID,
                                  HashMap<Integer,ArrayList<Integer>> tokenPathsOfDoc)
method name: markNeitherNor -OLD() this method is called from the case where the trigger is for sure only a "negTrigger" in the execute() method from the ExtractNegatorScope class. function: this method takes care of the "neither...nor" pattern or when the sentence contains only a "neither" or a "nor" token. protected static void markNeitherNor(AnnotationSet tokenAnnotationSetOfSentence, AnnotationSet triggerWordsAnnotationSet, AnnotationSet outputScopeAnnotations, AnnotationSet syntaxTreeNodeAnnotationSet, ArrayList notAnnotationsAlreadyAnnotated,String outputAnnotationType,AnnotationSet depRelationsSetOfSentence) { for(Annotation currentTokenA : tokenAnnotationSetOfSentence) { // find deps ... Annotation matchedDepTokenForPreconj = InvestigateDependencies.findMoreDepsForToken(currentTokenA, "preconj",true, tokenAnnotationSetOfSentence,depRelationsSetOfSentence); if(matchedDepTokenForPreconj!=null) { if(matchedDepTokenForPreconj.getFeatures().get("string").toString().trim().toLowerCase().equals("neither")) { // get the NEG Annotation of neither Annotation theTriggerForPreconj= GenericScopeHelperClass.findTriggerAnnotation(triggerWordsAnnotationSet,matchedDepTokenForPreconj); Annotation matchedDepTokenForCC = InvestigateDependencies.findMoreDepsForToken(currentTokenA, "cc",true, tokenAnnotationSetOfSentence,depRelationsSetOfSentence); // need to here find our nor within the nor conjunct if(matchedDepTokenForCC !=null) { if(matchedDepTokenForCC.getFeatures().get("string").toString().trim().toLowerCase().equals("nor")) { // get the NEG Annotation of nor Annotation theTriggerForCC= GenericScopeHelperClass.findTriggerAnnotation(triggerWordsAnnotationSet,matchedDepTokenForCC); Annotation matchedDepTokenForConj = InvestigateDependencies.findMoreDepsForToken(currentTokenA, "conj",true, tokenAnnotationSetOfSentence,depRelationsSetOfSentence); if(matchedDepTokenForConj !=null) { // have a neither nor pattern... CreateAnnotations.annotateTheScopeForNeitherNor(currentTokenA, matchedDepTokenForPreconj,matchedDepTokenForCC,matchedDepTokenForConj,syntaxTreeNodeAnnotationSet,outputScopeAnnotations,outputAnnotationType,theTriggerForPreconj,theTriggerForCC); notAnnotationsAlreadyAnnotated.add(currentTokenA); notAnnotationsAlreadyAnnotated.add(matchedDepTokenForCC); notAnnotationsAlreadyAnnotated.add(matchedDepTokenForPreconj); }//ifConj exists }// if == nor }//ifCC exists }//if == neither // if it is not neither we just have the nor case ... }// if preconj exists //NEW CASE 2 :: JUST NOR :: JUST NEITHER.... else if ((currentTokenA.getFeatures().get("string").toString().trim().toLowerCase().equals("nor"))||(currentTokenA.getFeatures().get("string").toString().trim().toLowerCase().equals("neither"))) { if((GenericScopeHelperClass.findIfAlreadyAnnotated(notAnnotationsAlreadyAnnotated, currentTokenA)==false)) { boolean alreadyDone = false; if(currentTokenA.getFeatures().get("string").toString().trim().toLowerCase().equals("nor")) { // make sure that if it was a neither, nor pattern that it was annotated already in the last clause Annotation foundNeither = GenericScopeHelperClass.findExistingAnnotation(tokenAnnotationSetOfSentence,"neither"); if((foundNeither!=null)&& (InvestigateDependencies.findDepOfGovenorForAToken(foundNeither, "preconj",depRelationsSetOfSentence) == true)) { alreadyDone =true; } }// end nor check ... if((currentTokenA.getFeatures().get("string").toString().trim().toLowerCase().equals("neither")) && (InvestigateDependencies.findDepOfGovenorForAToken(currentTokenA, "preconj",depRelationsSetOfSentence) == true)) { // make sure that if it was a neither, nor pattern that it was annotated already in the last clause Annotation foundNor = GenericScopeHelperClass.findExistingAnnotation(tokenAnnotationSetOfSentence,"nor"); if(foundNor!=null) { alreadyDone =true; } }// end nor check ... if(alreadyDone==false) { // make sure it is not already annotated Annotation theNegTriggerForNor= GenericScopeHelperClass.findTriggerAnnotation(triggerWordsAnnotationSet,currentTokenA); if((theNegTriggerForNor!=null)) { // check if we have a nor case that does not have the deps if ((currentTokenA.getFeatures().get("string").toString().trim().toLowerCase().equals("nor"))) { Annotation foundNeither = GenericScopeHelperClass.findExistingAnnotation(tokenAnnotationSetOfSentence,"neither"); if((foundNeither!=null)) { Annotation theNegTriggerForNeither= GenericScopeHelperClass.findTriggerAnnotation(triggerWordsAnnotationSet,foundNeither); CreateAnnotations.annotateTheScopeForNorOrNeither(currentTokenA,syntaxTreeNodeAnnotationSet,outputScopeAnnotations,outputAnnotationType,theNegTriggerForNor); notAnnotationsAlreadyAnnotated.add(currentTokenA); } else { CreateAnnotations.annotateTheScopeForNorOrNeither(currentTokenA,syntaxTreeNodeAnnotationSet,outputScopeAnnotations,outputAnnotationType,theNegTriggerForNor); notAnnotationsAlreadyAnnotated.add(currentTokenA); } } // check if we have a neither case that does not have the deps if ((currentTokenA.getFeatures().get("string").toString().trim().toLowerCase().equals("neither"))) { CreateAnnotations.annotateTheScopeForNorOrNeither(currentTokenA,syntaxTreeNodeAnnotationSet,outputScopeAnnotations,outputAnnotationType,theNegTriggerForNor); notAnnotationsAlreadyAnnotated.add(currentTokenA); Annotation foundNor = GenericScopeHelperClass.findExistingAnnotation(tokenAnnotationSetOfSentence,"nor"); if((foundNor!=null)) { notAnnotationsAlreadyAnnotated.add(foundNor); } } }// if the trigger is not null and not already annotated }// if alreadyDone==false } // new if ... }// else if }// for }// method /*************************************************************************** method name: markNeither**NEW CASE() this method is called from the case where the trigger is for sure only a "negTrigger" in the execute() method from the ExtractNegatorScope class. function: this method takes care of the "neither" pattern.

markNonDependencyCases

protected static void markNonDependencyCases(gate.AnnotationSet tokenAnnotationSetOfSentence,
                                             gate.AnnotationSet triggerWordsAnnotationSet,
                                             gate.AnnotationSet outputScopeAnnotations,
                                             gate.AnnotationSet syntaxTreeNodeAnnotationSet,
                                             ArrayList<gate.Annotation> notAnnotationsAlreadyAnnotated,
                                             String outputAnnotationType)
method name: markNonDependencyCases()** new added because this method is called from the first condition clause in the execute() in the ExtractScopeNegator class. function: this method is called in the case(s) where the scope to be determined does not rely on dependency relations & is determined to not have the conventional scope.

prepareParametersForExtendedCaseNo

protected static void prepareParametersForExtendedCaseNo(gate.AnnotationSet outputScopeAnnotations,
                                                         gate.AnnotationSet syntaxTreeNodeAnnotationSet,
                                                         gate.Annotation newGov,
                                                         gate.Annotation newDep,
                                                         String outputAnnotationType,
                                                         HashMap<Integer,ArrayList<Integer>> tokenPathsOfDoc,
                                                         int choiceForAnn,
                                                         gate.Annotation theTriggerFound,
                                                         ArrayList<gate.Annotation> notAnnotationsAlreadyAnnotated,
                                                         gate.AnnotationSet tokenAnnotationSetOfSentence)
method name: prepareParametersForExtendedCase() this method is called from a method which handles the "det" relation in the DepRules class. function: this is a method which handles the preparation of the scope parameters for negation triggers such as "no", "noone", "nobody"... (quantifiers) - which need to be dealt with differently to other dependency cases in the determination of the relevent scope.
